description: The yellow buckeye is a deciduous tree native to the United States. Its name comes from its bright yellow-green buds, which open to become large panicles of fragrant yellow flowers in spring. The foliage is a mix of dark yellow-green, giving it an especially vibrant look. Its fruit is a large, round, brown nut with a distinctive beaklike point at its tip. Its hardiness allows it to thrive in a range of soil and climatic conditions, with yellow buckeyes often found in open woodland, riverbanks, and gardens. With its bright yellow blooms, hardy nature, and large, interesting nuts, the yellow buckeye is a delight to behold and a great choice for any garden!
